ValidityState.summary: The ValidityState interface represents the validity states that an element can be in, with respect to constraint validation. Together, they help explain why an element's value fails to validate, if it's not valid.

remarks.para:
-Guide: Constraint validation
-Tutorial: Form data validation

ValidityStateBadInput.summary: The read-only badInput property of the ValidityState interface indicates if the user has provided input that the browser is unable to convert. For example, if you have a number input element whose content is a string.

remarks.para:
-ValidityState valid, customError properties.
-Guide: Constraint validation
-Tutorial: Form data validation

ValidityStateBadInput.value: A boolean that is true if the ValidityState object does not conform to the expected type.

ValidityStateCustomError.summary: The read-only customError property of the ValidityState interface returns true if an element doesn't meet the validation required in the custom validity set by the element's method.

remarks.para:
-ValidityState badInput, valid properties.
-Constraint validation
-Forms: Data form validation

ValidityStateCustomError.value: A boolean that is true if a custom error message has been set to a non-empty string.

ValidityStatePatternMismatch.summary: The read-only patternMismatch property of the ValidityState interface indicates if the value of an input, after having been edited by the user, does not conform to the constraints set by the element's pattern attribute.

remarks.para: The patternMismatch property will be true if and only if the following conditions are all true:

-Constraint validation
-Forms: Data form validation
-Regular Expressions

ValidityStatePatternMismatch.value: A boolean that is true if the ValidityState object does not conform to the constraints.

ValidityStateRangeOverflow.summary: The read-only rangeOverflow property of the ValidityState interface indicates if the value of an input, after having been edited by the user, does not conform to the constraints set by the element's max attribute.

remarks.para: If the field is numeric in nature, including the input/date, input/month, input/week, input/time, input/datetime-local, input/number and input/range types and a max value is set, if the value doesn't conform to the constraints set by the max value, the rangeOverflow property will be true.

-
-Constraint validation
-Forms: Data form validation
-step attribute
-min attribute

ValidityStateRangeOverflow.value: A boolean that is true if the ValidityState does not conform to the constraints.

ValidityStateRangeUnderflow.summary: The read-only rangeUnderflow property of the ValidityState interface indicates if the value of an input, after having been edited by the user, does not conform to the constraints set by the element's min attribute.

remarks.para: If the field is numeric in nature, including the input/date, input/month, input/week, input/time, input/datetime-local, input/number and input/range types and a min value is set, if the value doesn't conform to the constraints set by the min value, the rangeUnderflow property will be true.

-
-Constraint validation
-Forms: Data form validation
-step attribute
-max attribute

ValidityStateRangeUnderflow.value: A boolean that is true if the ValidityState does not conform to the constraints.

ValidityStateStepMismatch.summary: The read-only stepMismatch property of the ValidityState interface indicates if the value of an input, after having been edited by the user, does not conform to the constraints set by the element's step attribute.

remarks.para: If the field is numeric in nature, including the input/date, input/month, input/week, input/time, input/datetime-local, input/number and input/range types and the step value is not any, if the value don't doesn't conform to the constraints set by the step and min values, then stepMismatch will be true. If the remainder of the form control's value less the min value, divided by the step value (which defaults to 1 if omitted) is not zero, there is a mismatch.

-Constraint validation
-Forms: Data form validation
-step attribute

ValidityStateStepMismatch.value: A boolean that is true if the ValidityState does not conform to the constraints.

ValidityStateTooLong.summary: The read-only tooLong property of the ValidityState interface indicates if the value of an input or textarea, after having been edited by the user, exceeds the maximum code-unit length established by the element's maxlength attribute.

remarks.para:
-Constraint validation
-Forms: Data form validation

ValidityStateTooLong.value: A boolean that is true if the ValidityState does not conform to the constraints.

ValidityStateTooShort.summary: The read-only tooShort property of the ValidityState interface indicates if the value of an input, button, select, output, fieldset or textarea, after having been edited by the user, is less than the minimum code-unit length established by the element's minlength attribute.

remarks.para:
-Guide: Constraint validation
-Tutorial: Form data validation

ValidityStateTooShort.value: A boolean that is true if the ValidityState does not conform to the constraints.

ValidityStateTypeMismatch.summary: The read-only typeMismatch property of the ValidityState interface indicates if the value of an input, after having been edited by the user, does not conform to the constraints set by the element's type attribute.

remarks.para: If the type attribute expects specific strings, such as the input/email and input/url types and the value doesn't conform to the constraints set by the type, the typeMismatch property will be true.

The input/email input type expects one or more valid email addresses, depending on whether the multiple attribute is present. A valid email address includes an email prefix and a domain, with or without a top level domain. If the value of the email input is not an empty string, a single valid email address, or one or more comma separated email address if the multiple attribute is present, there is a typeMismatch.

The input/url input type expects one or more valid URLs, depending on whether the multiple attribute is present. A valid URL includes a protocol, optionally with an IP address, or an optional subdomain, domain, and top level domain combination. If the value of the URL input is not an empty string, a single valid URL, or one or more comma separated URLS if the multiple attribute is present, there is a typeMismatch.

td.para: email address, with or without TLD
protocol or full URL with protocol

remarks.para:
-ValidityState badInput, valid, customError properties.
-Constraint validation
-Forms: Data form validation
-Regular Expressions

ValidityStateTypeMismatch.value: A boolean that is true if the ValidityState does not conform to the constraints.

ValidityStateValid.summary: The read-only valid property of the ValidityState interface indicates if the value of an input element meets all its validation constraints, and is therefore considered to be valid.

remarks.para: If true, the element matches the :valid CSS pseudo-class; otherwise the :invalid CSS pseudo-class applies.

-ValidityState badInput, customError properties.
-Constraint validation
-Forms: Data form validation

ValidityStateValid.value: A boolean that is true if the ValidityState does conform to all the constraints.

ValidityStateValueMissing.summary: The read-only valueMissing property of the ValidityState interface indicates if a required control, such as an input, select, or textarea, has an empty value.

remarks.para: If the required attribute is set, and no option is selected or a <textarea> or user-editable <input> is empty, the valueMissing property will be true. The property is only true if the field is required and has no value; if the field is not required, or if the field is required and has a value, the value is false.

-ValidityState badInput, valid properties.
-Constraint validation
-Forms: Data form validation
-Regular Expressions

ValidityStateValueMissing.value: A boolean that is true if the ValidityState is not set and the required attribute is.
